attributes.action: Hold a General Election in November 2016
attributes.additional_details: Leaders on both sides have resigned. There exists no viable plan of action following the referendum result. We believe a general election consisting of Brexit/Veto parties would give the people of the United Kingdom and Northern Ireland the constitutional right to democratically elect their next Prime Minister, reconsider the EU Referendum result and decide the direction of the country at this turbulent time.
attributes.background: Constitutional crisis, a nationwide referendum result of less than 3% margin on a turnout of less than 75%, falling £ and FTSE250, national/global uncertainty and the threat of UK breakup - We the undersigned demand a general election be held in Oct/Nov 2016 as PM David Cameron steps down
